Key Match Events: Kevin Durant scored 25 points and hit a game-tying fadeaway jumper to send the game to overtime.
Bradley Beal contributed 24 points while going 66% from the field.
James Harden scored 25 of his 29 points after halftime.
Amir Coffey brought a spark off the bench with 11 points in the fourth quarter, including a theatrical three mid-way through to extend the Clippers' lead to 10 points.
Pre-Game Insights: The game was the Clippers' Intuit Dome debut.
Kevin Durant admitted that 'The Wall' rattled him, a future first-ballot Hall of Famer in his 18th year in the NBA.
Post-Match Reflections: The Clippers showed lots of promise without Kawhi Leonard.
The Clippers will have to continue to feed off the energy their fans are giving them if they want a shot at the playoffs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Kevin Durant led the charge for Phoenix, scoring 25 points and hitting a number of clutch fourth-quarter buckets.
Shooting guard Amir Coffey also brought a much-needed spark off the bench as Norman Powell and Kevin Porter Jr. had off nights.
The Clippers' new arena, Intuit Dome, has already gone viral on social media for how intimidating it looked to Suns players shooting free throws.
